title: Pembrokeshire Winter Coast
suitableFor: Adventurous individuals and couples who enjoy bracing walks, dramatic scenery, and don't mind a bit of wind and rain. Must be comfortable with potentially challenging coastal walking conditions.
notSuitableFor: Those seeking guaranteed sunshine, luxury spa breaks, or have limited mobility.

stops.title: Storm Watching at Newgale Beach
stops.description: Witness the raw power of the Atlantic as winter storms batter the Pembrokeshire coast. Newgale's long, exposed beach is perfect for dramatic wave watching.

wetAlt.title: National Wool Museum
wetAlt.description: Explore the history of the Welsh wool industry at this fascinating museum in Dre-fach Felindre.

budgetAlt.title: Beach walk at Newgale
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a blustery walk along the beach, even in milder weather. Collect shells and enjoy the fresh air.

stops.title: The Shed at Porthgain
stops.description: A harbourside restaurant serving fresh seafood and hearty pub fare.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Porthgain Harbour
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own picnic while watching the boats bob in the harbour.

stops.title: Coastal Walk: Porthgain to Abereiddy
stops.description: A scenic section of the Pembrokeshire Coast Path, offering stunning views of the coastline and the Blue Lagoon (approx. 2 hours).

wetAlt.title: St Davids Cathedral
wetAlt.description: Explore this historic cathedral in the heart of St Davids. Marvel at the architecture and stained glass.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Abereiddy Blue Lagoon
budgetAlt.description: Walk around the perimeter of the former quarry and take photos of the dramatic landscape.

stops.title: St Davids YHA
stops.description: A comfortable and affordable hostel in the heart of St Davids, perfect for budget-conscious travelers.

budgetAlt.title: TYF Cliff-top Campsite
budgetAlt.description: A basic campsite near St Davids, offering stunning views.

stops.title: The Bishops
stops.description: A local pub in St Davids offering hearty meals.

budgetAlt.title: Shop in St Davids
budgetAlt.description: Buy food from the supermarket to cook at the YHA or campsite.

stops.title: Walk to Whitesands Beach
stops.description: A short walk to Whitesands Beach to enjoy the scenery.

wetAlt.title: Oriel y Parc Landscape Gallery
wetAlt.description: Explore art exhibitions showcasing the Pembrokeshire landscape.

stops.title: Wild Swimming at Whitesands Beach (Optional)
stops.description: A bracing dip in the sea for the hardy. Be aware of conditions, only swim if safe and confident.

wetAlt.title: Warm Drink at Whitesands Cafe
wetAlt.description: Relax with a warm drink at Whitesands Cafe.

stops.title: Whitesands Beach Cafe
stops.description: A cafe right on the beach.

stops.title: Drive to Freshwater West and explore the beach
stops.description: Drive 1 hour and explore Freshwater West beach, famous for Harry Potter filming.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Expect changeable weather, including strong winds, rain, and potentially some sunshine. Check the forecast before you go and be prepared for all conditions.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy in St Davids, especially during weekends and school holidays. Parking can be limited, so arrive early or use park-and-ride facilities. The roads to Freshwater West can be narrow and winding.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Accommodation should be booked well in advance, especially during peak season. Some restaurants may require reservations, particularly for dinner.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A reasonable level of fitness is required for coastal walking. Some sections of the Pembrokeshire Coast Path can be challenging, with steep climbs and uneven terrain. Be prepared for potentially muddy conditions.
